segment.source: Creating a Driver Package
segment.target: Creating a Driver Package

segment.source: Driver projects and packages
segment.target: Driver projects and packages

segment.source: A driver project is the Microsoft Visual Studio project which produces a driver binary (such as a .sys file), and potentially the driver's INF file.
segment.target: A driver project is the Microsoft Visual Studio project which produces a driver binary (such as a .sys file), and potentially the driver's INF file.

segment.source: A driver package is the collection of files used to install a driver.
segment.target: A driver package is the collection of files used to install a driver.

segment.source: The package includes an INF file, and files and binaries referred to by that INF.
segment.target: The package includes an INF file, and files and binaries referred to by that INF.

segment.source: Visual Studio uses driver packages to automatically deploy and debug your driver to a remote target.
segment.target: Visual Studio uses driver packages to automatically deploy and debug your driver to a remote target.

segment.source: A driver package is a separate project which collects output from one or more projects, such as driver projects.
segment.target: A driver package is a separate project which collects output from one or more projects, such as driver projects.

segment.source: The driver package's project, when built, then produces the driver package which Visual Studio uses to deploy the driver.
segment.target: The driver package's project, when built, then produces the driver package which Visual Studio uses to deploy the driver.

segment.source: Visual Studio Solution Explorer Driver Package Project
segment.target: Visual Studio Solution Explorer Driver Package Project

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you use a driver template to create a driver solution, then the template should automatically create a solution that contains two projects.
segment.target: If you use a driver template to create a driver solution, then the template should automatically create a solution that contains two projects.

segment.source: One for the driver, and another for the driver package.
segment.target: One for the driver, and another for the driver package.

segment.source: Manually creating a driver package
segment.target: Manually creating a driver package

segment.source: If your solution does not have a driver package, you can manually create one in Visual Studio by choosing New Project from the File menu.
segment.target: If your solution does not have a driver package, you can manually create one in Visual Studio by choosing New Project from the File menu.

segment.source: For examples of how to create a driver package, see Writing Your First Driver.
segment.target: For examples of how to create a driver package, see Writing Your First Driver.

segment.source: To manually create a new driver package for an existing solution that does not already have one, use the "Driver Install Package" template.
segment.target: To manually create a new driver package for an existing solution that does not already have one, use the "Driver Install Package" template.

segment.source: Select New Project from the File menu.
segment.target: Select New Project from the File menu.

segment.source: Then select Windows Driver Package "Driver Install Package" from the dialog.
segment.target: Then select Windows Driver Package "Driver Install Package" from the dialog.

segment.source: Visual Studio will associate the newly created driver package with all the driver projects that were present in the solution when the driver package is created.
segment.target: Visual Studio will associate the newly created driver package with all the driver projects that were present in the solution when the driver package is created.

segment.source: Modifying an existing driver package
segment.target: Modifying an existing driver package

segment.source: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference other projects in the solution.
segment.target: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference other projects in the solution.

segment.source: Right-click on the driver package and select Properties....
segment.target: Right-click on the driver package and select Properties....

segment.source: Expand Common Properties and select References.
segment.target: Expand Common Properties and select References.

segment.source: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking Add New Reference... and selecting the project to reference.
segment.target: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking Add New Reference... and selecting the project to reference.

segment.source: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click Remove Reference.
segment.target: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click Remove Reference.

segment.source: Driver Package Properties
segment.target: Driver Package Properties

segment.source: Multiple drivers in a solution
segment.target: Multiple drivers in a solution

segment.source: You can add multiple drivers and their packages to your solution.
segment.target: You can add multiple drivers and their packages to your solution.

segment.source: Similar to "Modifying an existing driver package" you can create a new driver solution, or add a reference to an existing one.
segment.target: Similar to "Modifying an existing driver package" you can create a new driver solution, or add a reference to an existing one.

segment.source: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference additional driver projects in the solution.
segment.target: If your solution already contains a driver package, you can modify it to reference additional driver projects in the solution.

segment.source: Right-click on the existing driver package and select Properties....
segment.target: Right-click on the existing driver package and select Properties....

segment.source: Expand Common Properties and select References.
segment.target: Expand Common Properties and select References.

segment.source: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking Add New Reference... and selecting the project to reference.
segment.target: You can add a reference to other projects in the solution by clicking Add New Reference... and selecting the project to reference.

segment.source: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click Remove Reference.
segment.target: To remove a reference to an existing project, first highlight the existing project you no longer want to reference, then click Remove Reference.

segment.source: See the "Toaster Sample Driver" sample for an example of a single solution that contains multiple drivers:
segment.target: See the "Toaster Sample Driver" sample for an example of a single solution that contains multiple drivers:

segment.source: Multiple Drivers in a Single Solution
segment.target: Multiple Drivers in a Single Solution
